intro: Senecio triligulatus, commonly known as the three-toothed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a distinctive three-lobed shape, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Senecio triligulatus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
